notes: Dranove, Hughes, and Meltzer (2003/2012) 'Incentives and Promotion for Adverse Drug Reactions'. Panel FE analysis of pharmaceutical advertising and adverse drug reactions at drug-month level. Uses Poisson count models with drug FE and year-month dummies. The provided .dta only contains outcome variables (veryserious, any_fda) and limited controls (Dappr_cats) -- promotion expenditure variables (q1totalexp, q2q4totalexp, etc.) and demographic shares are referenced in code but NOT in the provided dataset. This severely limits executable specifications.

design_audit.notes: Poisson regression with drug FE (drug*) and year-month dummies ($yrm). Exposure variable is person-months. Estimated separately by condition (4 therapeutic areas). Robust SE. The provided data is missing key treatment variables (promotion expenditures) and most controls -- only drug identifiers, ADR counts, FDA labeling changes, and drug approval dummies are included.

claim_object.treatment_concept: Pharmaceutical promotion and advertising expenditures (total, professional, DTCA, cost-of-contact)
claim_object.estimand_concept: Effect of promotion spending on ADR reporting rates, conditional on drug and time FE
claim_object.target_population: FDA Adverse Event Reporting System (AERS) drug-month observations, 2003-2004, across 4 therapeutic conditions

baseline_specs.label: Table3-Condition3-Arthritis-Col1
baseline_specs.notes: Poisson: veryserious ~ q1totalexp + q2q4totalexp + generic + $char + $dapp + $age + $yrm + drug* if condition==3, exp(permonths) robust. NOTE: q1totalexp, q2q4totalexp, and most controls are NOT in the provided .dta file.

constraints.notes: Paper uses a fixed set of controls across all condition-specific regressions: generic indicator, patient characteristic shares ($char = 8 vars), drug approval age dummies ($dapp = 4 vars), age-gender shares ($age = 4 vars). Treatment variables vary (total expenditure, professional promo, DTCA, cost-of-contact). Most of these variables are NOT in the provided dataset.

canonical.notes: Robust (sandwich) standard errors for Poisson, matching the paper's 'robust' option.

variants.notes: Cluster at condition level (4 clusters -- likely too few).

budgets.notes: Moderate budget. Major constraint: most treatment and control variables are NOT in the provided dataset. Executable specs may be limited to those using only the available variables.

sampling.notes: Controls organized into blocks: drug characteristics ($char = 8), drug approval age ($dapp = 4), age-gender demographics ($age = 4), generic indicator (1). Block-level removal and random within-block sampling.

diagnostics_plan.notes: Check for overdispersion in Poisson model (motivates negative binomial alternative).

design_audit.notes: Logit model predicting any_fda labeling change from ADR counts (veryserious interacted with condition dummies). Condition dummies (c1-c3), year-month dummies, and controls. Cross-sectional logit (not conditional/fixed-effect logit due to drug FE separation issues).

claim_object.treatment_concept: Serious adverse drug reactions (veryserious, v_3, v_12 -- contemporaneous, 3-month, 12-month cumulative)
claim_object.estimand_concept: Association between ADR reporting and FDA regulatory action (labeling changes)

baseline_specs.label: Table2-Logit-Contemporaneous
baseline_specs.notes: Logit: any_fda ~ c1 c2 c3 v1 v2 v3 v4 + generic + $char + $dapp + $age + $yrm. NOTE: Most controls not in provided data.

canonical.notes: Robust standard errors for logit (default in Stata logit with mfx).

budgets.notes: Smaller budget for the FDA labeling outcome. Data limitations constrain executable specs.
